message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.GR, cs.AI, cs.NE 

The paper proposes a novel graph-convolution operator for 3D shape analysis using deep learning techniques. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper also involves learning effective shape representations from raw input coordinates, which suggests the involvement of machine learning techniques, making cs.LG (Machine Learning) another likely sub-category. The paper also deals with graph-structured data, which suggests the involvement of graph theory, making cs.GR (Computer Science and Game Theory) another likely sub-category. Additionally, the paper involves the use of neural networks, which suggests the involvement of artificial intelligence, making cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) another likely sub-category. Finally, the paper involves the use of deep learning techniques, which suggests the involvement of neural networks, making cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) another likely sub-category.
